meanings.definition: Deceptive or false statements or actions intended to deceive or trick others.
meanings.sent1: The salesman's humbuggeries about the magical properties of the product convinced many customers to buy.
meanings.sent2: The audience saw through the politician's humbuggeries and refused to believe his promises.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's playful humbuggeries about his imaginary friend always made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her elaborate web of humbuggeries eventually unraveled, revealing the truth behind her schemes.
meanings.sent5: The detective was skilled at unraveling the humbuggeries of con artists and revealing the facts.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to his humbuggeries; he's just talking nonsense.
meanings.sent2: The children giggled at the teacher's playful humbuggeries during class.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's stories were always filled with delightful humbuggeries that entertained the grandchildren.
meanings.sent4: The conspiracy theories were nothing but humbuggeries, lacking any basis in reality.
meanings.sent5: The book was filled with whimsical humbuggeries that sparked the imagination of the readers.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in deceitful or dishonest behavior.
meanings.sent1: The notorious con artist was known as the master of humbuggeries in the city.
meanings.sent2: Beware of that smooth-talking humbuggeries; he will try to deceive you.
meanings.sent3: The cunning humbuggeries managed to swindle many unsuspecting victims with their charm.
meanings.sent4: She saw through the facade of the charming humbuggeries and exposed their true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The community rallied together to protect themselves from the humbuggeries preying on their trust.
